formattedAddress: 285 Mott St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 285 Mott St, New York, NY 10012, USA

editorialSummary.text: Expect the usual sushi lineup & cooked dishes in a tiny space with sidewalk tables.

originalText.text:
This restaurant is on its last legs.  It once had a great staff and made terrific food, even during the pandemic! I stopped by today for the beef teriyaki lunch special, I wanted the beef to be done to medium  my side was sashimi.
The soup and salad were fine, hard to ruin. The bento box came and the waitress knew it was bad  before she placed it in front of me. Normally the beef is sliced and placed to look like a single piece of steak with a little separation, not my plate of food! it looked like a bad stir fry and every piece of meat looked like they came from different cows and every piece was so over cooked, my leather boots looked softer! Was the kitchen really busy, you ask me? Only one other person entered after me and he order the 3 roll sushi special!  I mentioned to the waitress I ordered my meat to be cooked medium and she blamed a busy kitchen! I told her I would reluctantly eat it because I didn't want to wait longer for another piece to be cooked and she seemed pleased. But as I  tried to eat, I also tried  to assemble the meat as one piece and couldn't!  I called her over and asked if it was leftovers, ( that would explain why it was dry, over cooked and tasteless) , she swore it was made to order even though it was overcooked! Sashimi was my side and it must have been a new rookie because each slice of fish was thick enough to be 2 slices, that was a loss for the restaurant but good for me!. A refill of tea didn'tarrive until the check came and as she took away the bento box, I showed the waitress that the pieces of meat weren't from the same steak, the thickness and widths of the pieces I left in the box were all different!
She was annoyed I noticed but she said nothing.
I can never recommend Mottsu ever again to anyone.

originalText.text: Delicious sushi especially tempura sushi . Nice service. Cozy atmosphere,  very calming music .

text.text: Delicious sushi especially tempura sushi . Nice service. Cozy atmosphere,  very calming music .

originalText.text: This place is a gem!!! I was looking for a walk in Japanese restaurant on Saturday afternoon and found this place! The service super friendly and warm, the food was really good and you have to try the sushi tiramisu (or something like that). The only thing they have to improve is the restroom. And the location is very nice too.

text.text: This place is a gem!!! I was looking for a walk in Japanese restaurant on Saturday afternoon and found this place! The service super friendly and warm, the food was really good and you have to try the sushi tiramisu (or something like that). The only thing they have to improve is the restroom. And the location is very nice too.

originalText.text: Amazing! Highly highly recommend Mottsu. It is such a great hole in the wall. I order takeout from here a lot but saw they had a new all you can eat special ($33) and I wanted to check it out. Hands down the best AYCE sushi in the city. Each roll is made with such care - you can see the chef at the bar making each roll with such precision. If you come, get the Soho roll it’s one of my favorite bites of sushi ever.  Don’t come in expecting a super fancy ambiance; come for a filling meal with great food and great service. If you are looking for an all you can eat place in the city this is your spot.

originalText.text: Pretty damn impressed with this place. Literally the biggest sashimi I’ve ever had in my entire life. Its an entire mouthful of a sashimi. Most places aren’t this generous. Nigiri is on point too. Very reasonable sake prices. Great bar vibe and service as well. 5 star highly recc’d
